sndlib.core.network
Class Link

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.network.Link

public final class Link
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a link between two nodes in a Network.

Besides its ID a link has several properties, namely a setup cost, routing cost, and a pre-installed capacity as well as a number of additional capacities (modules) which can be installed on this link.

For constructing a new Link a parent Network is needed.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
Network, Network.newLink(String, Node, Node)

getPreCapacity

public double getPreCapacity()
Returns the pre-installed capacity of this link.

Returns:
the pre-installed capacity

setPreCapacity

public void setPreCapacity(double preCapacity)
Sets the pre-installed capacity of this link. It can be used for expansion planning problems or for allocation problems. A link with positive pre-installed capacity must be included in every solution with at least that capacity.

Parameters:
preCapacity - the pre-installed capacity of this link
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified capacity is lower than zero

moduleCount

public int moduleCount()
Returns the number of additional capacity modules installable on this link.

Returns:
the number of additional modules

hasModule

public boolean hasModule(double capacity)
Tests whether this link contains a additional module with the specified capacity.

Parameters:
capacity - the capacity to look for
Returns:
true if and only if this link contains a additional module with the specified capacity; false otherwise

getModule

public CapacityModule getModule(double capacity)
Returns the module with the specified capacity.

Parameters:
capacity - the capacity of the module
Returns:
the module with the specified capacity; null if this link does not contain such a additional capacity module

modules

public java.util.Collection<CapacityModule> modules()
Returns a Collection view of the additional capacity modules installable on this link.

The returned collection is unmodifiable. That means that each attempt to modify the collection will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection view of the additional capacity modules of this link.

setPreCost

public void setPreCost(double preCost)
Sets the cost incurred by the pre-installed capacity of this link.

Parameters:
preCost - the cost incurred by the pre-installed capacity
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified pre-installed capacity cost is lower than zero

addModule

public void addModule(CapacityModule module)
Specifies a new capacity module which can be installed on this link.

Parameters:
module - a new capacity module for this link
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this link already contains a module with the capacity of the given one

removeModule

public boolean removeModule(CapacityModule module)
Removes the given capacity module from this link.

Parameters:
module - the capacity module to remove
Returns:
true if and only if the given module was removed from this link; false otherwise

getSetupCost

public double getSetupCost()
Returns the setup cost of this link.

Returns:
the setup cost of this link

setSetupCost

public void setSetupCost(double setupCost)
Sets the setup cost of this link. The setup cost is incurred if this link is included in the final solution topology. In particular, this is the case if the link has preinstalled capacity.

Parameters:
setupCost - the setup cost
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified setup cost is lower than zero.

getRoutingCost

public double getRoutingCost()
Returns the routing cost of this link.

Returns:
the routing cost of this link

setRoutingCost

public void setRoutingCost(double routingCost)
Sets the routing cost of this link. The routing cost is incurred by any unit of flow (in terms of routing unit 1) using the link.

Parameters:
routingCost - the routing cost of this link
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified routing cost is lower than zero

Returns a textual representation of this link.

a textual representation of this link
